def: To rub and cleanse without wetting. Dodsley.
An instrument to thrash with; a flail. [Obs. or Prov. Eng.]Halliwell.
The French name for concrete; hence, concrete made after theFrench fashion.
A genus of annelids, belonging to the Oligoch√¶ta, and includingthe common earthworms. See Earthworm.
A crystal of one species inclosing one of another species. SeeEndomorph.
A term designating both a quality and the subject in which itexists; a concrete term.The concretes "father" and "son" have, or might have, the abstracts"paternity" and "filiety". J. S. Mill.

The art or process of making a compound by putting theingredients together, as contrasted with analysis; thus, water ismade by synthesis from hydrogen and oxygen; hence, specifically, thebuilding up of complex compounds by special reactions, whereby theircomponent radicals are so grouped that the resulting substances areidentical in every respect with the natural articles when such occur;thus, artificial alcohol, urea, indigo blue, alizarin, etc., are madeby synthesis.
Able or disposed to revive; reviving. E. Darwin.
One bred at the same school; an associate in school.
A sacrifice, or ceremony, by which cities, fields, armies, orpeople, defiled by crimes, pestilence, or other cause of uncleanness,were purified.
One who makes signals with a flag.
